question:
The Crown-of-Thorns Starfish has been in news recently. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. These starfishes feed on the skeletons of corals.
  2. Population outbreak of these starfish is an issue in the Great Barrier Reef.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Crown-of-Thorns starfish belong to the class of animals called Echinoderms. These starfishes feed on the living tissue found in the coral skeletons. They curb the spread of coral reefs. They are found in the Indo-Pacific region and are one of the largest starfishes in the world. Statement 2 is incorrect: The outbreak of these starfishes in the Great Barrier Reef is a major cause of concern. These are referred to as ‘plagues’ and are said to be destroying large portions of the largest coral reef system in the world.
